intro: Senecio praecox, commonly known as early senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. Senecio praecox is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
